story.storybody:
During the pendency of the 2002 Gulbarg Society communal carnage trial, accused no 64 - Shivcharan alias Jitendra alias Lallo Ramji Rai spent the entire time in judicial custody. He could not manage getting bail while most of the 60 accused had managed to do so. But with a stroke of luck, he became one of the 36 accused in the case who were being set free.

RELEASED FROM CUSTODY

Sitting BJP corporator, Bipin Patel, who was accused no 60 in the Gulbarg Society case too walked free with his supporters. Public prosecutor in the case RC Kodekar explained, "24 eye witnesses had come to court and recognised the 24 accused and apart from this there was direct evidence too and that is why these 24 people have been convicted. But for others, there was no direct evidence, and the court was not convinced with the evidence against the other 36 and so they had to be acquitted." The court has convicted all 24 accused in the case under various sections of the Indian Penal Code read with Bombay Police Act.

Some of the accused were convicted of murder while all of them will now be sentenced for rioting with deadly weapons, unlawful assembly, promoting enmity between groups, obstructing public servant from discharging duty and causing damage to houses.

However the court has rejected the conspiracy angle that the prosecution had based most of their arguments on.
